name: Kyiv
fun_fact: Fun fact: Kyiv's metro stations are among the deepest in the world - Arsenalna station descends 105.5 meters (346 feet) underground, deeper than the length of a football field! The deep tunnels were built as nuclear bunkers during the Cold War.

hero_dishes.name: Chicken Kyiv
hero_dishes.description: Breaded chicken breast stuffed with herbed garlic butter that spurts when cut
hero_dishes.origin_story: Despite the name, it may have originated in French cuisine and was popularized globally from Soviet-era restaurants. Authentic versions use bone-in chicken

hero_dishes.name: Borscht
hero_dishes.description: Vibrant beet soup with cabbage, potatoes, and meat, served with sour cream and pampushky (garlic bread)
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ukraine claims borscht as its national dish (UNESCO recognized Ukrainian borscht cooking tradition in 2022). Over 30 regional variations exist

hero_dishes.name: Varenyky
hero_dishes.description: Ukrainian dumplings filled with potato, sauerkraut, meat, or sweet fillings like cherry
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ancient Slavic dish - the potato version with sour cream and fried onions is essential comfort food

hero_dishes.name: Salo
hero_dishes.description: Cured pork fatback, sliced thin, often with garlic and black bread
hero_dishes.origin_story: The ultimate Ukrainian delicacy - there's even a monument to salo in Kyiv. Best from Polissya region
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bessarabsky Market, any traditional restaurant, with shots of horilka

signature_drinks.name: Horilka
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Ice cold, with salo and pickles - toasts are elaborate and meaningful

signature_drinks.name: Kompot
signature_drinks.description: Sweet fruit drink made from stewed dried fruits
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: With meals, especially in summer - every Ukrainian grandmother's recipe is 'the best'

food_culture_notes: Bessarabsky Market (1912) is the grand covered market for local produce
Puzata Hata is beloved cafeteria chain for authentic Ukrainian food
Kyiv Cake (Kyivsky Tort) is the famous hazelnut meringue souvenir
Ukrainian hospitality means you'll never leave hungry - expect multiple courses
